description: The inspector noted finding a dead roach on top of a freezer and insect “parts” and feces on a shelf above the freezer. Now the eatery has been rechecked.
title: DeKalb restaurant rechecked after 'insect feces' concern
title_page: DeKalb restaurant rechecked after 'insect feces' concern
text:
Update: The restaurant was rechecked Monday and received a 94. Read the new report here.
Original story:
A Stone Mountain bistro failed a health inspection after officials said they found evidence of insects.
Ameribistro, located at 945 Hairston Rd., received a 68 on the Monday inspection, according to the inspector’s report.
The inspector noted finding a dead roach on top of a freeze and insect “parts” and feces on a shelf above the freezer.
The report says swai, a white, flaky fish, was being advertised on the menu as catfish.
Ameribistro 345 Hairston Road, Suite 2, Stone Mountain Score: 68 Full report: here.
Other concerns included a dirty air filter on the ice machine and the fact that no one was in charge, the report said.
An employee at the restaurant said Thursday they’re working to address concerns. A message left for the manager wasn’t immediately returned.
